text.71:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menyuruh Rasul-Nya supaya bertanya kepada orang-orang yang mempersekutukan-Nya. Andai kata Allah menjadikan malam ini terus menerus sepanjang masa sampai hari Kiamat tanpa ada siang yang menyelinginya, apakah di antara sembahan-sembahan mereka itu kuasa dan mampu mendatangkan siang untuk dapat dimanfaatkan cahayanya? Apakah kaum musyrikin itu tidak mempergunakan pendengarannya? Mereka itu seakan-akan tuli. Kalaulah mereka mempergunakan akal sebaik-baiknya, tentu mereka akan insaf dan sadar serta mengetahui dengan yakin bahwa hanya Allah Yang Mahakuasa yang dapat mendatangkan malam untuk menggantikan siang apabila dikehendaki. Dia mendatangkan siang untuk menghapuskan malam apabila Dia kehendaki dan tiada sesuatu pun yang dapat melakukan yang demikian itu.

Firman Allah:

Dan Kami jadikan malam dan siang sebagai dua tanda (kebesaran Kami), kemudian Kami hapuskan tanda malam dan Kami jadikan tanda siang itu terang. (al-Isra'/17: 12)
text.72:
Kandungan ayat ini kebalikan dari ayat sebelumnya. Pada ayat ini, Allah menyuruh Rasul-Nya menanyakan kepada orang-orang musyrik, andaikata Allah menjadikan siang itu terus menerus sepanjang masa sampai di hari Kiamat tanpa ada malam silih berganti dengannya, apakah ada tuhan selain dari Allah yang mampu mendatangkan malam? Apakah mereka tidak memperhatikan tanda-tanda kekuasaan Allah yang sempurna? Seakan-akan mereka tidak punya pikiran. 

Sekiranya mereka memperhatikan dengan baik, tentu mereka akan mengambil kesimpulan bahwa tidak ada yang layak disembah kecuali Tuhan yang telah memberikan karunia dan nikmat yang tak terhingga banyaknya dan kuasa menjadikan siang dan malam itu silih berganti untuk terciptanya suatu keseimbangan. Siang dijadikan terang untuk mencari rezeki dengan segala kemampuan yang ada. Kemudian siang itu lenyap digantikan oleh malam yang suasananya cocok digunakan untuk melepaskan dan menghilangkan kelelahan agar tenaga dan pikiran kembali pulih guna mencari rezeki pada keesokan harinya. Firman Allah:

Dan Dia (pula) yang menjadikan malam dan siang silih berganti bagi orang yang ingin mengambil pelajaran atau yang ingin bersyukur.(al-Furqan/25: 62)

Menurut kajian ilmiah, sinar matahari dalam ilmu pengetahuan fisika merupakan pancaran gelombang energi yang dihasilkan dari reaksi nuklir fusi dan fisi yang terjadi di permukaan matahari secara berkesinambungan. Ketika sinar ini dipancarkan secara terus menerus dan dalam waktu cukup lama akan menimbulkan panas 

Apa yang akan terjadi sekiranya siang terus menerus sampai hari Kiamat? Sudah pasti keadaan udara dan hawa dari detik ke detik, dari menit ke menit dan dari jam ke jam akan menjadi semakin panas. Dalam waktu 100 jam saja udara bisa mencapai temperatur di atas titik didih 100ÂºC. Karenanya, lautan, danau, sungai, dan sebagainya akan mendidih dan menggelegak. Dapat dibayangkan apa yang akan terjadi sekiranya seluruh sungai, danau, dan samudera mendidih airnya? Begitu juga darah yang mengalir di dalam tubuh kita juga turut mendidih. Dalam keadaan demikian, tidak ada satu pun makhluk yang dapat hidup. Semuanya akan mati dan musnah menjadi debu-debu yang beterbangan. 

Allah juga menjadikan malam sebagai waktu istirahat bagi manusia. Semuanya itu bertujuan agar manusia dapat mem-bayangkan betapa hebatnya kekuasaan Allah dan juga perlindungan yang diberikan-Nya untuk kehidupan setiap makhluk ciptaan-Nya khususnya manusia yang dikaruniai akal pikiran yang sempurna.
text.73:
Pergantian siang dan malam dengan fungsinya masing-masing, yaitu siang digunakan untuk berusaha mencari rezeki dan malam digunakan untuk istirahat dan melepaskan lelah, sehingga pulih kembali tenaga yang telah dipergunakan pada siang harinya, adalah merupakan rahmat besar dari Allah yang tak ternilai harganya dan wajib disyukuri. Nikmat yang tak disyukuri akan hilang lenyap dicabut dan ditarik kembali oleh Allah. Sebaliknya nikmat yang disyukuri dengan memanfaatkannya sebaik-baiknya sesuai dengan perintah Allah, akan bertambah terus. Firman Allah:

Dan (ingatlah) ketika Tuhanmu memaklumkan, "Sesungguhnya jika kamu bersyukur, niscaya Aku akan menambah (nikmat) kepadamu, tetapi jika kamu mengingkari (nikmat-Ku), maka pasti azab-Ku sangat berat." (Ibrahim/14: 7)
text.74: Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa di hari Kiamat Allah akan memanggil orang-orang musyrik dan berkata kepada mereka, "Di mana sekutu-sekutu-Ku yang kalian anggap sebagai sekutu-Ku di dunia? Dapatkah mereka itu melepaskan kalian dari keadaan yang menghimpit sekarang ini." Sengaja orang musyrik dipanggil pada waktu itu untuk mengikrarkan suatu kesaksian atas penyembahan mereka selain dari Allah. Ini juga bertujuan supaya mereka mengetahui bahwa mempersekutukan Allah itu adalah sebab paling utama atas kemurkaan-Nya, sebagaimana mengesakan-Nya adalah sebab utama atas rida-Nya.
text.75:
Allah menerangkan bahwa di hari Kiamat Dia akan mendatangkan saksi atas tiap-tiap umat. Tiap rasul akan menjadi saksi atas umatnya masing-masing, sampai di mana sambutan dan penerimaan umatnya itu kepada agama yang dibawanya dari Allah. Nabi Muhammad pun akan menjadi saksi pada umatnya nanti di hari Kiamat, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Dan bagaimanakah (keadaan orang kafir nanti), jika Kami mendatangkan seorang saksi (rasul) dari setiap umat dan Kami mendatangkan engkau (Muhammad) sebagai saksi atas mereka. (an-Nisa'/4: 41) 

Orang-orang musyrik di hari Kiamat akan dimintai pertanggungjawaban atas perbuatan syiriknya. Mereka juga dimintai keterangan dan alasan-alasan untuk membenarkan perbuatan mereka, yang tentunya mereka tidak dapat mengemukakan satu alasan pun. Pada waktu itulah mereka mengetahui bahwa mereka akan diazab untuk selama-lamanya dalam neraka. Firman Allah:

Maka Aku memperingatkan kamu dengan neraka yang menyala-nyala, yang hanya dimasuki oleh orang yang paling celaka, yang mendustakan (kebenaran) dan berpaling (dari iman). (al-Lail/92: 14-16) 

Pada waktu itu, mereka akan sadar dan yakin bahwa apa yang telah diterangkan Allah melalui nabi-Nya itulah yang benar. Lenyaplah sama sekali dari mereka segala apa yang dahulunya mereka ada-adakan di dunia seperti mendustakan rasul yang diutus kepada mereka, mempersekutukan Allah, dan sebagainya.
text.76:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa Karun termasuk kaum Nabi Musa, dan masih terhitung salah seorang pamannya. Karun juga mempunyai nama lain, yaitu "al-Munawar" (bercahaya) karena wajahnya yang tampan. Ia paling banyak membaca kitab Taurat di antara teman-temannya dari Bani Israil, hanya dia munafik seperti halnya Samiri. Ia berlaku aniaya dan sombong terhadap sesama Bani Israil.

Dan sekiranya Allah melapangkan rezeki kepada hamba-hamba-Nya niscaya mereka akan berbuat melampaui batas di bumi, tetapi Dia menurunkan dengan ukuran yang Dia kehendaki. Sungguh, Dia Mahateliti terhadap (keadaan) hamba-hamba-Nya, Maha Melihat. (asy-Syura/42: 27)

Kekayaan melimpah ruah dan perbendaharaan harta yang banyak yang diberikan Allah kepadanya, sehingga kunci-kunci tidak sanggup dipikul oleh sejumlah orang-orang yang kuat karena beratnya, menyebabkan ia sangat bangga, berlaku aniaya, dan sombong terhadap sesamanya serta memandang remeh dan hina mereka. Ibnu 'Abbas mengatakan bahwa kunci-kunci perbendaharaan harta Karun dapat dibawa oleh empat puluh laki-laki yang kuat. 

Sekalipun ia diperingatkan oleh kaumnya agar jangan terlalu membanggakan hartanya yang berlimpah-limpah dan kekayaan yang bertumpuk-tumpuk itu, karena Allah tidak menyukai orang yang membanggakan diri, tetapi ia tidak menggubrisnya sama sekali. Ia tetap bangga dan menyombongkan diri. Peringatan dan larangan terlalu gembira dan bangga atas pemberian Allah itu ditegaskan juga dalam ayat lain, sebagaimana firman Nya:

Agar kamu tidak bersedih hati terhadap apa yang luput dari kamu, dan jangan pula terlalu gembira terhadap apa yang diberikan-Nya kepadamu. Dan Allah tidak menyukai setiap orang yang sombong dan membanggakan diri. (al-hadid/57: 23) 

Allah tidak menyukai orang yang sombong dan membanggakan diri. (an-Nisa'/4: 36)
text.77:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menerangkan empat macam nasihat dan petunjuk yang ditujukan kepada Karun oleh kaumnya. Orang yang mengamalkan nasihat dan petunjuk itu akan memperoleh kesejahteraan di dunia dan akhirat.

1. Orang yang dianugerahi oleh Allah kekayaan yang berlimpah ruah, perbendaharaan harta yang bertumpuk-tumpuk, serta nikmat yang banyak, hendaklah ia memanfaatkan di jalan Allah, patuh dan taat pada perintah-Nya, mendekatkan diri kepada-Nya untuk memperoleh pahala sebanyak-banyaknya di dunia dan akhirat.

Sabda Nabi saw:

Manfaatkan yang lima sebelum datang (lawannya) yang lima; mudamu sebelum tuamu, sehatmu sebelum sakitmu, kayamu sebelum miskinmu, waktu senggangmu sebelum kesibukanmu dan hidupmu sebelum matimu. (Riwayat al-Baihaqi dari Ibnu 'Abbas)

2. Setiap orang dipersilakan untuk tidak meninggalkan sama sekali kesenangan dunia baik berupa makanan, minuman, pakaian, serta kesenangan-kesenangan yang lain sepanjang tidak bertentangan dengan ajaran yang telah digariskan oleh Allah. Baik Allah, diri sendiri, maupun keluarga, mempunyai hak atas seseorang yang harus dilaksanakannya. Sabda Nabi Muhammad: 

Kerjakanlah seperti kerjanya orang yang mengira akan hidup selamanya. Dan waspadalah seperti akan mati besok. (Riwayat al-Baihaqi dari Ibnu 'Umar)

3. Setiap orang harus berbuat baik sebagaimana Allah berbuat baik kepadanya, misalnya membantu orang-orang yang memerlukan, menyambung tali silaturrahim, dan lain sebagainya.

4. Setiap orang dilarang berbuat kerusakan di atas bumi, dan berbuat jahat kepada sesama makhluk, karena Allah tidak menyukai orang-orang yang berbuat kerusakan.
text.78:
Ayat ini menerangkan reaksi Karun atas nasihat dan petunjuk yang diberikan oleh kaumnya. Dengan sombong ia berkata, "Harta yang diberikan Allah kepadaku adalah karena ilmu yang ada padaku. Allah mengetahui hal itu. Oleh karena itu, Ia rida padaku dan memberikan harta itu kepadaku." Tidak sedikit manusia apabila ditimpa bahaya, ia kembali kepada Tuhan, dan berdoa sepenuh hati. Semua doa yang diketahuinya dibaca dengan harapan supaya bahaya yang menimpanya itu lenyap. Jika maksudnya itu tercapai, ia kemudian lupa kepada Tuhan yang mencabut bahaya itu darinya. Bahkan, ia mengaku bahwa hal itu terjadi karena kepintarannya, karena perhitungan yang tepat, dan sebagainya. Firman Allah:

Maka apabila manusia ditimpa bencana dia menyeru Kami, kemudian apabila Kami berikan nikmat Kami kepadanya dia berkata, "Sesungguhnya aku diberi nikmat ini hanyalah karena kepintaranku." Sebenarnya, itu adalah ujian, tetapi kebanyakan mereka tidak mengetahui. (az-Zumar/39: 49) 

Pengakuan seperti tersebut di atas ditolak oleh Allah dengan firman Nya, "Apakah ia lupa ataukah tidak pernah mengetahui bahwa Allah telah membinasakan umat dahulu sebelum dia, padahal mereka itu jauh lebih kuat dan lebih banyak harta yang dikumpulkannya." Sekiranya Allah memberi seseorang harta kekayaan dan lainnya hanya karena kepintaran dan kebaikan yang ada padanya, sehingga Allah rida kepadanya, tentu Dia tidak akan membinasakan orang-orang dahulu yang jauh lebih kaya, kuat dan pintar dari Karun. Orang yang diridai Allah tentu tidak akan dibinasakan-Nya. Tidakkah ia menyaksikan nasib Fir'aun yang mempunyai kerajaan besar dan pengikutnya yang banyak dengan sekejap mata dihancurkan oleh Allah.

Pada akhir ayat ini, Allah menegaskan bahwa apabila Dia hendak mengazab orang-orang yang bergelimang dosa itu, Dia tidak akan menanyakan berapa banyak dosa yang telah diperbuatnya, begitu juga jenisnya, karena Dia Maha Mengetahui semuanya itu. Dalam ayat lain ditegaskan juga sebagai berikut:

Maka pada hari itu manusia dan jin tidak ditanya tentang dosanya. (ar-Rahman/55: 39)
text.79:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa pada suatu hari Karun keluar ke tengah-tengah kaumnya dengan pakaian yang megah dan perhiasan yang berlebihan dalam suatu iring-iringan yang lengkap dengan pengawal, hamba sahaya, dan inang pengasuh untuk mempertontonkan ketinggian dan kebesarannya kepada manusia. Hal yang demikian itu adalah sifat yang amat tercela, kebanggaan yang terkutuk bagi orang yang berakal dan berpikiran sehat. Hal itu menyebabkan kaumnya terbagi dua.

Pertama, orang-orang yang mementingkan kehidupan duniawi yang selalu berpikir dan berusaha sekuat tenaga bagaimana caranya supaya bisa hidup mewah di dunia ini. Menurut anggapan mereka, hidup yang demikian itu adalah kebahagiaan. Mereka itu berharap juga dapat memiliki sebagaimana yang dimiliki Karun yaitu harta yang bertumpuk-tumpuk dan kekayaan yang berlebih-lebihan, karena yang demikian itu dianggap sebagai keberun-tungan yang besar. 

Dengan demikian mereka akan hidup senang, dan berbuat sekehendak hatinya merasakan kenikmatan dunia dengan segala variasinya. Keinginan manusia seperti ini sampai sekarang tetap ada, bahkan tumbuh dengan subur di tengah-tengah masyarakat. Di mana-mana kita dapat menyaksikan bahwa tidak sedikit orang yang berkeinginan keras untuk memiliki seperti apa yang telah dimiliki orang-orang kaya, pengusaha besar, dan lainnya, seperti rumah besar dengan perabot serba mewah, mobil mewah, tanah, dan sawah ladang yang berpuluh-puluh bahkan beratus hektar. Hal itu mereka lakukan sekalipun menggunakan jalan yang tidak wajar, yang tidak sesuai dengan hukum agama dan peraturan negara. Hal itu menyebabkan timbulnya kecurangan dan korupsi di mana-mana.
text.80:
Ayat ini menerangkan kelompok kedua yaitu orang-orang yang berilmu dan berpikiran waras. Mereka menganggap bahwa cara berpikir orang-orang yang termasuk golongan pertama tadi sangat keliru, bahkan dianggap sebagai satu bencana besar dan kerugian yang nyata, karena lebih mementingkan kehidupan dunia yang fana dari kehidupan akhirat yang kekal. Golongan kedua berpendapat bahwa pahala di sisi Allah bagi orang-orang yang percaya kepada Allah dan rasul-Nya serta beramal saleh, jauh lebih baik daripada menumpuk harta. Apa yang di sisi Allah kekal abadi, sedangkan apa yang dimiliki manusia akan lenyap dan musnah, sebagaimana firman-Nya:

Apa yang ada di sisimu akan lenyap, dan apa yang ada di sisi Allah adalah kekal. (an-Nahl/16: 96)

Ayat 80 diakhiri satu penjelasan bahwa yang dapat menerima dan mengamalkan nasihat dari ayat di atas hanyalah orang-orang yang sabar dan tekun mematuhi perintah Allah, menjauhi larangan-Nya. Mereka juga menerima baik apa yang telah diberikan Allah kepadanya serta membelanjakannya untuk kepentingan diri dan masyarakat.
text.81: Pada ayat ini, Allah menerangkan akibat kesombongan dan keangkuhan Karun. Ia beserta rumah dan segala kemegahan dan kekayaannya dibenamkan ke dalam bumi. Tidak ada yang dapat menyelamatkannya dari azab Allah itu, baik perorangan maupun secara bersama-sama. Karun sendiri tidak dapat membela dirinya. Tidak sedikit orang yang sesat jalan, dan keliru paham tentang harta yang diberikan kepadanya. Mereka menyangka harta itu hanya untuk kemegahan dan kesenangan sehingga mereka tidak menyalurkan penggunaannya ke jalan yang diridai Allah. Oleh karena itu, Allah menimpakan azab-Nya kepada mereka.
text.82:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa orang-orang yang semula bercita-cita ingin mempunyai kedudukan dan posisi terhormat seperti yang pernah dimiliki Karun, dengan seketika mengurungkan cita-citanya setelah menyaksikan azab yang ditimpakan kepada Karun. Mereka menyadari bahwa harta benda yang banyak dan kehidupan duniawi yang serba mewah, tidak mengantarkan mereka pada keridaan Allah. Dia memberi rezeki kepada yang dikehendaki-Nya, dan tidak memberi kepada yang tidak dikehendaki. Allah meninggikan dan merendahkan orang yang dikehendaki-Nya. Kesemuanya itu adalah berdasarkan kebijaksanaan Allah dan ketetapan yang telah digariskan-Nya.

Diriwayatkan dari Ibnu Mas'ud bahwa Allah telah memberikan kepada manusia watak masing-masing sebagaimana Dia telah membagi-bagikan rezeki di antara mereka. Sesungguhnya Allah itu memberikan harta kepada orang yang disenangi, dan tidak menganugerahkan iman kecuali kepada orang yang disenangi dan dikasihi-Nya.

Mereka merasa memperoleh karunia dari Allah karena cita-cita mereka belum tercapai. Andaikata sudah tercapai, tentu mereka dibenamkan juga ke dalam bumi sebagaimana yang telah dialami Karun. Pengertian mereka bertambah mantap bahwa tidak beruntung orang-orang yang mengingkari nikmat Allah, mendustakan rasul-Nya, dan pahala yang dijanjikan di akhirat bagi orang yang taat kepada-Nya. Mereka akan dimusnahkan oleh azab, firman Allah:

Dan sungguh, telah datang kepada mereka seorang rasul dari (kalangan) mereka sendiri, tetapi mereka mendustakannya, karena itu mereka ditimpa azab dan mereka adalah orang yang zalim. (an-Nahl/16: 113)
text.83:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa kebahagiaan dan segala kenikmatan di akhirat disediakan untuk orang-orang yang tidak takabur, tidak menyombongkan diri, dan tidak berbuat kerusakan di muka bumi seperti menganiaya dan sebagainya. Mereka itu bersifat rendah hati, tahu menempatkan diri kepada orang yang lebih tua dan lebih banyak ilmunya. Kepada yang lebih muda dan kurang ilmunya, mereka mengasihi, tidak takabur, dan menyom-bongkan diri. Orang yang takabur dan menyombongkan diri tidak disukai Allah, akan mendapat siksa yang amat pedih, dan tidak masuk surga di akhirat nanti, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Adapun orang-orang yang beriman dan mengerjakan kebajikan, Allah akan menyempurnakan pahala bagi mereka dan menambah sebagian dari karunia-Nya. Sedangkan orang-orang yang enggan (menyembah Allah) dan menyombongkan diri, maka Allah akan mengazab mereka dengan azab yang pedih. Dan mereka tidak akan mendapatkan pelindung dan penolong selain Allah. (an-Nisa'/4: 173) 

Sabda Rasulullah saw:

Tidak akan masuk surga orang yang ada di dalam hatinya sifat takabur, sekalipun sebesar zarah. (Riwayat Muslim dan Abu Dawud dari Ibnu Mas'ud) 

Ayat 83 ini ditutup dengan penjelasan bahwa kesudahan yang baik berupa surga diperoleh orang-orang yang takwa kepada Allah dengan mengamalkan perintah-Nya, menjauhi larangan-Nya, tidak takabur dan tidak menyombongkan diri seperti Fir'aun dan Karun.
text.84:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa siapa yang di akhirat datang dengan membawa satu amal kebajikan, akan dibalas dengan yang lebih baik, dan dilipatgandakan sebanyak-banyaknya. Tidak ada yang mengetahui berapa kelipatannya kecuali Allah sebagai karunia dan rahmat dari-Nya. Rasulullah saw bersabda:

Siapa yang bermaksud akan mengerjakan satu kebaikan, kemudian tidak jadi dikerjakannya, Allah mencatat pahala pada sisi-Nya satu kebaikan yang sempurna, kalau ia bermaksud mengerjakan satu kebaikan lalu dikerjakannya, maka Allah mencatat (pahala) dengan sepenuh kebaikan sampai tujuh ratus kali lipat, bahkan lipat ganda yang lebih banyak lagi. (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim dari Ibnu 'Abbas)

Dalam hadis lain Rasulullah bersabda:

Dan barang siapa yang bermaksud mengerjakan satu kejahatan kemudian tidak dikerjakannya, maka ditulislah oleh Allah swt di sisi-Nya satu kebaikan yang sempurna, dan kalau ia bermaksud mengerjakan kemudian dikerjakannya, maka Allah mencatatkan baginya hanya satu kejahatan saja. (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim dari Ibnu 'Abbas)

Hal ini sesuai dengan firman Allah:

Dan barang siapa membawa kejahatan, maka disungkurkanlah wajah mereka ke dalam neraka. Kamu tidak diberi balasan, melainkan (setimpal) dengan apa yang telah kamu kerjakan. (an-Naml/27: 90)
text.85:
Pada ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Dialah yang mewajibkan kepada Muhammad mengamalkan isi Al-Qur'an, dan melaksanakan hukum-hukum dan perintah yang ada di dalamnya. Dia pulalah yang akan mengembalikan Muhammad ke tanah suci Mekah, tanah tumpah darahnya dalam keadaan menang dan merebutnya kembali dari kaum yang telah mengusirnya dari sana. Muhammad saw kembali ke Mekah dengan satu kemenangan besar bagi kaum Muslimin, karena dengan demikian ia dapat mengembangkan Islam dengan bebas dan dapat menekan kehendak kaum musyrikin. Ini adalah janji dari Allah ketika Muhammad selalu disakiti dan mendapat tekanan yang berat dari kaumnya bahwa dia akan hijrah meninggalkan Mekah, dan akan kembali dalam keadaan menang. 

Selain kembali ke Mekah, ada yang berpendapat Allah mengembalikan Rasul kepada kematian atau mengembalikan ke surga, sebagaimana firman Allah:

Katakanlah (Muhammad), "Wahai kaumku! Berbuatlah menurut kedudukanmu, aku pun berbuat (demikian). Kelak kamu akan mengetahui, siapa yang akan memperoleh tempat (terbaik) di akhirat (nanti). Sesungguhnya orang-orang yang zalim itu tidak akan beruntung. (al-An'am/6: 135)
text.86:
Ayat ini menerangkan bahwa Muhammad tidak pernah mengharapkan diturunkannya Al-Qur'an kepadanya untuk mengetahui berita-berita orang-orang sebelumnya, dan hal-hal yang terjadi sesudahnya, antara lain seperti agama yang mengandung kebahagiaan bagi manusia di dunia dan akhirat, dan juga adab-adab yang meninggikan derajat mereka dan mencerdaskan akal pikiran mereka. Sekalipun demikian, Allah menurunkan semuanya itu kepada Muhammad sebagai rahmat dari-Nya.

Pada ayat ini, Allah melarang Nabi Muhammad dan umatnya untuk membantu perjuangan orang-orang kafir dalam bentuk apa pun. Umat Muhammad justru dituntut untuk membantu memperkuat perjuangan umat Islam. Oleh karena itu, hendaklah ia memuji Tuhannya atas nikmat yang dikaruniakan kepadanya dengan penurunan kitab suci Al-Qur'an. Nabi saw tidak perlu menolong dan membantu orang-orang musyrik yang mengingkari Kitab suci Al-Qur'an itu, tetapi hendaklah ia memisahkan diri dan berpaling dari mereka sesuai dengan firman Allah:

Maka sampaikanlah (Muhammad) secara terang-terangan segala apa yang diperintahkan (kepadamu) dan berpalinglah dari orang yang musyrik. (al-hijr/15: 94)
text.87:
Allah menganjurkan kepada Muhammad agar tidak mengindahkan tipu daya orang-orang kafir, dan jangan sekali-kali terpengaruh sehingga mereka berhasil menghalang-halangi penyampaian ayat-ayat suci Al-Qur'an sesudah diturunkan kepadanya. Allah selalu bersamanya dan menguatkan serta memenangkan agama-Nya dari orang-orang kafir. Bahkan Nabi saw diperintahkan menyeru kaumnya ke jalan Allah dan menyampaikan agama-Nya kepada mereka, menyembah hanya kepada Allah saja yang tidak ada sekutu bagi-Nya. Pada akhir ayat ini, Allah menekankan supaya Muhammad jangan sekali-kali meninggalkan dakwahnya, dan selalu menyampaikan risalahnya kepada kaum musyrikin, supaya dia tidak seperti mereka, bermaksiat menyalahi perintah-Nya. Di ayat lain diterangkan:

Dan jangan sekali-kali kamu masuk golongan orang-orang musyrik. (al-An'am/6: 14
text.88:
Pada ayat ini, Allah melarang Nabi Muhammad menyembah sembahan lain selain Allah, karena tiada Tuhan yang patut disembah kecuali Allah, sebagaimana firman Nya:

(Dialah) Tuhan timur dan barat, tidak ada tuhan selain Dia, maka jadikanlah Dia sebagai pelindung. (al-Muzzammil/73: 9) 

Allah itu kekal abadi sekalipun semua makhluk yang ada sudah mati dan binasa. Firman Allah:

Semua yang ada di bumi itu akan binasa, tetapi wajah Tuhanmu yang memiliki kebesaran dan kemuliaan tetap kekal. (ar-Rahman/55: 26-27) 

Dan sabda Nabi Muhammad saw:

Ungkapan paling benar yang diucapkan penyair adalah yang diucapkan oleh Labid, yaitu: "Ketahuilah setiap sesuatu selain dari Allah akan binasa." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim dari Abu Hurairah)

Allah-lah yang mempunyai kerajaan, dan berbuat sekehendak-Nya. Dia-lah yang menentukan segala sesuatu yang akan berlaku kepada semua makhluk. Kepada-Nyalah akan dikembalikan semuanya, dan dibalas menurut amal perbuatannya masing-masing. Kalau ia beramal baik, taat, dan patuh kepada perintah Allah, akan dimasukkan ke dalam surga. Sebaliknya kalau ia berbuat maksiat dan bergelimang dosa, akan dimasukkan ke dalam neraka. Nabi saw bersabda sebagaimana diriwayatkan dari Abu Hurairah:

Semua umatku akan masuk surga kecuali yang tidak mau. Barang siapa taat kepadaku, maka ia masuk ke dalam surga, dan barang siapa durhaka kepadaku, maka sungguh ia telah enggan. (Riwayat al-Bukhari dari Abu Hurairah).

text.1: Ta Sin Mim, see the commentary regarding the letters of the alphabet at the beginning of Surah al-Baqarah.
text.2: In this verse, Allah affirms that the verses revealed to the Prophet Muhammad are verses from the Qur'an that are clear and easy to understand. These verses provide explanations about matters related to religious affairs and reveal the stories of past peoples whose truth was unknown to people at that time. This shows that the Qur'an is not the creation of Muhammad (peace be upon him) as accused by the polytheists, because Muhammad was an *ummi* (unlettered) who did not know how to write or read. He also never studied with learned people, let alone with the priests of the People of the Book. From where could the Prophet Muhammad have known the stories of peoples who lived centuries ago if not from the revelation that Allah had sent down to him? Therefore, there is no doubt that the verses of the Qur'an that contain laws and matters related to religion, as well as stories about ancient peoples, are truly a revelation from Allah.
text.3:
In this verse, it is explained that Allah recited to Prophet Muhammad, through the intermediary of Gabriel, verses related to the story of Prophet Musa and Pharaoh to serve as a lesson for the believers. By paying attention to that story, where they learn that the fate of the disobedient is punishment and the believers are freed from the oppression of the unjust, they become more convinced that the Qur'an is indeed a revelation sent down by Allah to Muhammad saw.

This verse mentions that the story of Prophet Musa is narrated specifically for the believers, even though the Qur'an was revealed for all of humanity, both believers and disbelievers. The purpose is to explain that only believers can benefit from the presentation of the stories of past peoples because they have clear minds and pure hearts, and are not influenced by things that pollute the soul and intellect.

As for those who disbelieve and remain in disbelief, it is impossible for them to benefit from it, because they have fallen far into polytheism. Their hearts have been dominated by feelings of envy, arrogance, and pride, and they like to indulge their desires, making it difficult for them to accept the truth that contradicts their wishes and desires. No matter how clear the verses and evidence presented, they will still deny and reject it with various far-fetched reasons, such as saying that Muhammad saw is crazy or that the miracles revealed to him are merely magic.
text.4:
In this verse, Allah explains the story of Pharaoh, who held absolute power in the land of Egypt. There was no power higher than his. Whatever he liked and desired had to be carried out. All the people were submissive and obedient to his commands, until he elevated himself to the status of a god.

With that absolute power, he could commit injustice and oppression arbitrarily. His rule was not based on justice and noble morals, but solely on his will and desires. The politics he practiced was to divide his people into several groups. Then he planted the seeds of conflict and animosity among those groups so that he could maintain power over them. Any movement that he felt opposed his power had to be eradicated and completely eliminated. If there was news or an issue saying that someone or a group was trying to overthrow his power or might cause his downfall, he would surely destroy that person or group.

Those who were considered loyal and always supported and strengthened his throne would be glorified. They were also given various facilities and privileges to make them strong and prosperous. Pharaoh oppressed the Children of Israel (Bani Israil) because they were considered a dangerous group, which if left unchecked would erode his government. He treated this group arbitrarily, degraded and humiliated them, and considered them as slaves who had no rights. This group was even forced to build pyramids and do other rough and heavy work. Especially after he heard from his soothsayers that it was the Children of Israel who would bring down his power. Since then, Pharaoh was determined to exterminate this group.

In addition to weakening and enslaving the Children of Israel, Pharaoh also decreed that every male child born among the Children of Israel must be killed, without mercy. He did not care about the cries of mothers who lost children they had carried with difficulty for nine months and who were the focus of their hopes.

With this action, Pharaoh thought that the Children of Israel would become extinct on their own because there would be no more male descendants to be born and develop. As for the female children, they were allowed to live because, besides being considered weak and unable to fight back, they were also used to satisfy lust. Therefore, Allah branded Pharaoh as a person who committed destruction on earth.

Actually, there were many other ways that did not contradict humanity that Pharaoh could have done to prevent what he feared from happening. However, because his heart had hardened into stone and his mind was darkened, there was no other way he could see except to exterminate all the male children of the Children of Israel. Pharaoh then spread spies throughout Egypt to investigate all the women. If any of them were pregnant, they were immediately recorded and awaited their delivery. If a girl was born, she would be left alone, but if a boy was born, he would be immediately taken to be killed.

Could Pharaoh maintain his power with that action? Certainly not! Because behind his power, there is a power that is far more mighty, namely the power of Allah, which cannot be defeated by anyone. He is the Creator, the Almighty, and the Most Powerful.

It is narrated by as-Suddi that Pharaoh dreamed of seeing fire coming to his country from Baitul Makdis. The fire burned the houses of Pharaoh's people and spared the houses of the Children of Israel. Pharaoh asked the wise men and soothsayers. They replied that the interpretation of the dream was that a male child (from the Children of Israel) would be born who would overthrow his power in Egypt. This interpretation is what prompted Pharaoh to take that cruel and violent action.
text.5:
In this verse, Allah explains that He will bestow His grace and favor upon the oppressed and weak Children of Israel by granting them worldly and religious strength and power. Thus, thanks to the struggles of the Children of Israel, a large and powerful kingdom was established in the land of Sham, and eventually they had great power in Egypt, which had previously oppressed and enslaved them. This is affirmed by Allah in His saying:

And We caused the people who had been oppressed to inherit the eastern regions of the land and the western ones, which We had blessed. And the good word of your Lord was fulfilled for the Children of Israel because of what they had patiently endured. And We destroyed [all] that Pharaoh and his people were producing and what they had been building. (al-A'raf/7: 137)

Thus, when Allah wills something, it will surely be fulfilled. No matter how strong Pharaoh was with his army and wealth, and no matter how weak the Children of Israel were, to the point of having no power at all and being constantly oppressed, persecuted, and antagonized, because Allah wanted to honor them, there was always a way and opportunity for them to rise and move forward. Thanks to their perseverance and patience, they succeeded in controlling the land of Egypt, which had once enslaved them.

Allah showed Pharaoh what he had always feared, as did Haman (his minister) and his army, namely the collapse of their kingdom with the birth of a baby, namely Moses. This baby escaped Pharaoh's surveillance and was even cared for and educated in his palace, and pampered and raised with love. In fact, it was that baby, when he grew up, who would overthrow his power, destroy his army, and conquer his country. How painful was the wound in Pharaoh's heart when he saw the child he loved and pampered, challenging and opposing his power.

Pharaoh's arrogance, pride, and haughtiness were indeed useless when faced with the power and might of Allah. All his actions were repaid with equivalent actions. Among the actions taken by Pharaoh that went beyond the limits were:

1. Considering himself absolutely powerful, so he acted arrogantly and proudly, even claiming himself as a god.

2. To ensure the continuity of his power, he divided his nation, annihilated those who opposed him, killed all the male babies of the Children of Israel, and allowed their daughters to live to be employed and made concubines and maids of the kingdom.

3. Acting arbitrarily and causing damage on earth.

Pharaoh's actions were reciprocated by Allah with several actions as well, namely:

1. Allah freed the Children of Israel from the clutches of Pharaoh and his people and made them leaders and leaders in the world.

2. Allah bequeathed to them the land of Sham by making them powerful there and giving them a place on earth.

3. Allah showed Pharaoh, Haman, and his army how their power collapsed.

Thus, Allah shows His power. Something that seemed impossible could happen, namely the fall of a great power by people who were weak, oppressed, and persecuted. Indeed, Allah has given power to whom He wills, and takes away power from whom He wills, as mentioned in His saying:

Say, "O Allah, Owner of Sovereignty, You give sovereignty to whom You will and You take sovereignty away from whom You will. You honor whom You will and You humble whom You will. In Your hand is [all] good. Indeed, You are over all things competent." (ali 'Imran/3: 26)

text.7:
This verse describes the very distressing situation of Moses' mother who was about to give birth to her child. She knew that the child would be snatched from her lap and killed without pity or compassion. Even if Moses' birth could be hidden, sooner or later it would be discovered by Pharaoh's spies who were scattered throughout the country, so the fate of her baby would be the same as the fate of other children of the Children of Israel. After giving birth to Moses, his mother always felt restless and worried about the fate of her child, whom she had carried with difficulty for nine months and who was the focus of her hopes after the baby grew up. Therefore, she always pleaded to Allah that her child be saved from the danger of death that always threatened him.

In that state of anxiety and worry, Allah inspired Moses' mother that she did not need to worry and be anxious. She should continue to breastfeed and take care of him as best as possible. If she felt afraid because there were signs that her child would be discovered by Pharaoh, then she should throw the child into the Nile River. Moses' mother was commanded by Allah not to feel doubt and worry, because He would protect and return Moses to her lap. Later, that child would become a messenger of Allah who would convey da'wah to Pharaoh.
text.8:
In this verse, it is explained how Moses' mother carried out the inspiration she received because she was certain that what Allah had promised her would surely come to pass. After baby Moses was wrapped and placed in a chest, he was cast into the Nile River, and the river's current carried him towards Pharaoh's palace, which was built on the riverbank.

One of Pharaoh's family members saw the chest floating along with the river's current and immediately took it and brought it to Pharaoh's wife. Upon opening it, she was very surprised to see that the chest contained a baby. At that moment, Pharaoh's wife felt affection for the baby. She quickly took the baby to Pharaoh. Without hesitation, Pharaoh ordered that the baby be killed, fearing that he was a descendant of the Children of Israel (Bani Israil). However, Pharaoh's wife persuaded him not to kill the baby, and to raise him as a son, hoping that the child would later be of service to Pharaoh and his kingdom. Finally, Pharaoh allowed his wife to adopt and care for the child, unaware that Allah willed this event to happen.

Allah willed that when the child grew up, he would become Pharaoh's greatest enemy and would overthrow his power, not become a child who would be of service and devoted to him. Thus, Allah decreed the downfall of Pharaoh's power, as a recompense for his arrogance, injustice, and cruelty towards the Children of Israel (Bani Israil). Indeed, Pharaoh, Haman, and his soldiers had committed a great error by committing that cruelty. It was only fitting that Allah destroy Pharaoh's power through a descendant of the Children of Israel (Bani Israil) whom he despised.
text.9:
In this verse, Allah explains Pharaoh's wife's response to prevent the baby from being killed, because Pharaoh was worried that the baby was a child of the Children of Israel who he feared would destroy his power. Pharaoh's wife, who had already grown fond of the child because she was attracted to his handsome appearance, said, "Do not kill this child because I am very fond of him and attracted to him. Let me raise and educate him. He will be a comfort to my heart and yours in times of trouble. Who knows, in the future he may be of service to us. Or how good it would be if we adopted him as our own child, because until now we have not been blessed with a child." Because of the persistence of Pharaoh's wife and the logical reasons she put forward, Pharaoh finally allowed the child to live and be raised by his wife herself.

Such is the decree of Allah. He made Pharaoh's wife love the child and softened Pharaoh's heart because of his wife's persuasion so that the child was not killed. In fact, that child would later oppose Pharaoh and become his main enemy without him realizing it at all.
text.10:
In this verse, Allah explains the state of Musa's mother after she cast her child into the Nile River to fulfill the inspiration she received from Allah. Even though her action was based on inspiration from Allah with the promise that her child would be returned to her, she remained restless and never felt at peace thinking about the fate of her child who had been carried away by the Nile River.

Various questions crossed Musa's mother's mind. Sometimes she regretted her actions. How would she find her child again? Would she shout and confess that she had thrown her child into the river, then ask the public for help to find him? Truly, her heart and mind were empty. She had lost her reason and consciousness, so she could no longer think. However, Allah strengthened her heart and calmed her mind, so she became aware and believed that Allah had promised to return her child to her embrace and would later raise him as a messenger.
text.11:
Even though Musa's mother had carried out what Allah had inspired her to do, her heart was not yet at peace. Therefore, she ordered her daughter (Musa's older sister) to seek news about Musa. Then Musa's sister went to follow the ark containing Musa. Finally, she saw from afar that the ark had entered Pharaoh's territory and was saved by his family. Although this event was witnessed by many people, they did not realize Musa's presence among them.

In the palace, people were busy looking for someone suitable to nurse the child, because he refused every woman who wanted to nurse him. After Musa's sister learned of this, she dared to come forward and say that she knew a woman who was healthy and had plenty of milk. Perhaps the child would be willing to be nursed by that woman. That woman was from a good family and the child would certainly be cared for with full attention and affection.

It is narrated from Ibn 'Abbas that after Musa's sister uttered those words, Musa's mother was brought to the palace. They looked at her with suspicion and asked, "How do you know that the woman will take good care of him and will pour out affection towards him?" Musa's sister replied, "Of course she will do so because she hopes for the pleasure of King Pharaoh and hopes for many gifts from him." With this answer, their suspicion disappeared.

Musa was then brought back to his mother's house. Upon arriving home, his mother placed Musa in her lap to nurse him. Immediately Musa's mouth caught his mother's nipple. Those present were very happy to see this and the queen's messenger was sent to announce it. The queen summoned Musa's mother and gave her many gifts and presents and asked her to stay in the palace to care for and raise Musa. Musa's mother politely refused the offer and told the queen that she had a husband and children and could not bear to leave them. She begged the queen to allow her to take Musa to her house. The queen did not object to the proposal and allowed Musa to be taken to his mother's house. The queen gave her sufficient expenses. In addition, the queen also gave her gifts in the form of money, clothes, and so on. Finally, Musa's mother returned home bringing her own child with a happy and joyful heart.

Allah had removed all of Musa's mother's anxiety and worry and replaced it with peace, glory, and abundant sustenance, and returned Musa to live with his mother.

text.13: This verse explains that Allah's promise to Moses' mother has been fulfilled, which was to return Moses to her so that her heart would be at peace and she would no longer feel sad. Likewise, Allah has fulfilled His promise to appoint Moses as a messenger, but most people do not know it. Who would have thought that a child who was targeted for death because he was a child of the Children of Israel would then be loved and cared for in the palace with love and affection, with the hope that he would be of service when he grew up? But, it turned out that the child would become a messenger and oppose the power of Pharaoh, even bringing down the kingdom itself.
text.14:
In these verses, it is explained that after reaching maturity, Allah bestowed upon Musa knowledge and wisdom because of his obedience and submission to the Lord, as well as his patience in facing various trials. It was only natural that Musa knew from his mother how he came to live in the palace of Pharaoh's family, even though he was just an ordinary child from the Children of Israel (Bani Israil) who were constantly humiliated and enslaved by Pharaoh and his people. This would arouse Musa's sympathy for the Children of Israel, even though Pharaoh had been instrumental in educating and raising him from childhood to become a healthy and well-being adult, both physically and mentally.

Sympathy for relatives and people is an instinct that cannot be separated from a person's soul, especially from Musa, who saw the Children of Israel oppressed and persecuted every day by the Qibthi people, the inhabitants of Egypt. However, thanks to the patience he possessed, as a gift from Allah, he was able to restrain his heart until Allah provided a way for him to lift his people from the valley of humiliation and suffering. Because of his patience, good character and behavior, and obedience in carrying out religious teachings, Musa was granted knowledge and wisdom by Allah as preparation for being appointed as a messenger (rasul). He was sent to convey Allah's message to his people and to Pharaoh, who was very arrogant, conceited, and proclaimed himself as a god.
text.15:
One day, Musa slipped into the city unnoticed by the crowds, when people were taking their afternoon nap after the Zuhr prayer. There he saw two men fighting, one from the Children of Israel (Bani Israil) and the other from the native inhabitants of Egypt, whom he considered an enemy because they always insulted and looked down upon the Children of Israel. The one from the Children of Israel cried out for help to free himself from the cruelty of his opponent.

Driven by fanaticism towards his people, Musa quickly pursued the Egyptian man. Out of anger and without thinking about the consequences of his actions, Musa struck the Egyptian man with all his might. As a result of the blow, the Egyptian man collapsed instantly and died. Actually, Musa had no intention of killing him at all, but it turned out that the man died with just one blow. Musa deeply regretted his rashness and considered his action wrong, a hasty action. He said to himself that his action was the work of Satan, who always deceives people into committing injustice and disobedience. Indeed, he had fallen into the trap of Satan, who is an enemy of mankind and always strives to mislead them.
text.16:
In this verse, it is explained that upon realizing his mistake, Musa pleaded for forgiveness from his Lord, saying, "Indeed, I have wronged myself by killing someone who should not have been killed. So forgive my sin and do not punish me for this unintentional act." Allah, the Most Forgiving and Most Merciful towards His servants, forgave Musa's mistake. With that forgiveness, Musa's heart became calm and free from doubt and worry about his fate for committing the sin. Indeed, that forgiveness is a mercy and favor from Allah. Among Allah's favors to Musa is mentioned in His word:

And you once killed a man, but We saved you from distress, and We tested you with a thorough testing. (Taha/20:40)

Musa promised not to repeat that mistake and not to be a helper to those who commit mistakes. Especially if that help would lead to oppression or murder and endanger himself.
text.17:
In this verse, it is explained that upon realizing his mistake, Moses pleaded for forgiveness from his Lord, saying, "Indeed, I have wronged myself by committing the killing of someone who should not have been killed. So forgive my sin and do not punish me for this unintentional act." Allah, the Most Forgiving and Most Merciful towards His servants, forgave Moses' mistake. With that forgiveness, Moses' heart became calm and free from doubt and distress about his fate for committing the sinful act. Indeed, that forgiveness is a mercy and favor from Allah. Among Allah's favors to Moses is mentioned in His saying:

And you once killed a man, but We saved you from distress, and We tested you with a series of trials. (thaha/20: 40)

Moses promised not to repeat that mistake and not to be a helper to those who commit wrongdoing. Especially if that assistance would lead to oppression or murder and endanger himself.
text.18:
Allah's forgiveness had brought relief and peace to his heart, but what about the native Egyptians among whom he lived? Would they simply let it pass if they found out about the killing? This greatly disturbed Musa's peace of mind and constantly weighed on his thoughts. Therefore, Musa secretly sought information to find out if his actions were known, and if they were, what their attitude would be? What action would they take against him?

As he walked through the city, he saw the man he had helped before shouting again, asking for help to fight another Egyptian. Apparently, the man he had helped before was again involved in a fight with another Egyptian. Perhaps the man was asking him to kill the Egyptian as he had killed before. It was pictured in his mind how he had sinned with that killing, but God, with His mercy and compassion, had forgiven his mistake. Would he make another mistake, especially since he had promised his Lord that he would not repeat that act?

Therefore, Musa said to the Israelite that he was a misguided person. However, it was also pictured in his mind the fate of his people who were humiliated and constantly persecuted by the Egyptians, so his anger rose again and he almost attacked the Egyptian. But before he attacked, the Egyptian rebuked him, saying, "Do you want to kill me as you killed his friend yesterday?" Apparently, the man had recognized Musa's face because people in the city were widely talking about the murder and the perpetrator.

Then the Egyptian rebuked him and said, "Indeed, you have acted arbitrarily on earth. You are not among those who do good." With that rebuke, Musa realized and remembered his promise that he would not repeat his mistake, so he did not hit the man.

According to some *mufasir*, the one who said those words to Musa was not an Egyptian but the Israelite he had helped, because Musa accused him of being misguided and wanted to hit him.
